message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s history and symptoms suggest a diagnosis of tuberous sclerosis complex. Among the options, only Ash-leaf spots are associated with this disorder. Cafe-au-lait spots are associated with neurofibromatosis, cavernous hemangioma with von Hippel-Lindau disease, and port-wine stain with Sturge-Weber syndrome.
